item.title: Samsung Galaxy S25 Slim might use completely new camera technology for better periscope zoom - Notebookcheck.net
item.description:
Samsung Galaxy S25 Slim might use completely new camera technology for better periscope zoom

Publication Date: Not specified. Source: Not specified.

Samsung's new camera technology for the Galaxy S25 Slim promises significant improvements, reducing the periscope module's length by 22% while enhancing picture quality.

  • Camera module length reduced by 22% and height decreased, resulting in a smaller camera bump.
  • Improved brightness and an f/2.58 aperture at an equivalent focal length of 80mm.
  • Samsung forecasts sales of 3 million Galaxy S25 Slim units, lower than the anticipated 37 million for other S25 variants.
"Those expecting a decline in picture quality will also be pleasantly surprised."

This new technology may attract consumers looking for slim smartphones with advanced camera capabilities.

item.title: Top Affordable 5G Phones Under ₹15,000 in India Before 2024 Ends - Analytics Insight
item.description:
Top Affordable 5G Phones Under ₹15,000 in India Before 2024 Ends

Published on: 26 Dec 2024, 5:30 pm

The world of 5G smartphones has never been more accessible, especially with the latest models under ₹15,000. These devices offer lightning-fast connectivity and pack high-end features such as better displays, enhanced camera capabilities, and extended battery life. As the year nears its end, the demand for budget-friendly 5G phones has surged.

  • Xiaomi Redmi Note 14 5G - ₹14,999: MediaTek Dimensity 6100+, 6.67-inch FHD+ AMOLED display, 50 MP rear camera, 5000 mAh battery.
  • Samsung Galaxy M15 5G - ₹14,499: MediaTek Dimensity 6100+, 6.6-inch FHD+ AMOLED display, 50 MP quad-camera, 6000 mAh battery.
  • Moto G64 - ₹12,999: MediaTek Dimensity 7025, 6.5-inch IPS LCD, 50 MP rear camera, 6000 mAh battery.
  • OnePlus Nord CE 4 Lite 5G - ₹14,999: Snapdragon 695, 6.67-inch AMOLED display, 50 MP rear camera, 5500 mAh battery.
  • Realme C53 - ₹10,999: 6.74-inch FHD+ LCD, 50 MP primary camera, 5000 mAh battery.
  • Poco M6 Pro 5G - ₹12,999: Snapdragon 4 Gen 2, 6.79-inch FHD+ IPS LCD, 50 MP dual rear camera, 5000 mAh battery.

item.title: Circle to Search expands to Nothing Phone (2) and Phone (2a) with Android 15 update - 9to5Google
item.description:
Circle to Search Expands to Nothing Phone Series with Android 15 Update

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: 9to5Google

Google’s Circle to Search feature is expanding to include the Nothing Phone series, specifically models (2), (2a), and (2a Plus) with the latest Android 15 update.

  • Circle to Search allows users to search their display by circling or tapping content.
  • The feature is rolling out now and requires specific build numbers for each phone model.
  • Other Nothing Phone models may support Circle to Search after future updates.

Circle to Search is now available on Nothing OS 3.0 based on Android 15 for Phone (2), Phone (2a), and Phone (2a) Plus devices after passing additional testing.

This update enhances user experience for Nothing Phone users, bringing new functionality to the devices.

item.title: Essential apps for hardcore Android users [Video] - 9to5Google
item.description:
Essential Apps for Hardcore Android Users

Date & Source: December 2024, 9to5Google

The article explores a curated list of must-have apps for Android users designed to enhance smartphone capabilities. Here are some personal favorite applications tailored for different needs.

  • Seal: A minimalist downloader for social media content.
  • Zerocam: A camera replacement app focused on unprocessed imagery.
  • Openvibe: An app that consolidates new social media platforms.
  • Twine: An elegant RSS reader for personalized news feeds.
  • AI Screenshot Finder: A tool for organizing and accessing screenshots efficiently.
  • Crate: A link management app to store and organize saved content.
  • Sponge: A fun file management app that helps clean up clutter.
  • Tooly: A comprehensive toolbox app with various utility features.
"Do you have any apps that you simply can’t live without?"

These apps are suggested for various tasks, whether you are looking to manage files, enhance your photography, or streamline your social media experience. Take a look and add them to your device for a better Android experience!

item.title: Empowering Indian Gamers: Zupee's vision for a homegrown gaming platform - India TV News
item.description:
Empowering Indian Gamers: Zupee's Vision for a Homegrown Gaming Platform

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: India TV News

The article discusses how Zupee is transforming traditional Indian games into a modern digital platform that caters to a diverse audience while promoting Indian culture.

  • Zupee revitalizes traditional Indian games by making them accessible in interactive, digital formats.
  • The platform focuses on skill-based gaming, removing chance elements and encouraging strategic gameplay.
  • Zupee aims for inclusivity, attracting players of varying skill levels, including those from tier 2 and 3 cities.
  • By promoting games deeply rooted in Indian culture, Zupee enhances cultural awareness among millions of users.
  • Committed to responsible gaming, Zupee utilizes RNG certification and blockchain technology to ensure fair play.
  • With over 100 million registered users, Zupee is a leading platform in India’s skill-based gaming sector.
Zupee stands as a shining example of how technology can be harnessed to celebrate and preserve Indian cultural traditions while creating new and exciting entertainment experiences for the digital age.

Zupee is not just reshaping the gaming landscape; it's fostering a community that blends cultural heritage with modern gaming thrills, offering a unique experience for Indian gamers.

item.title: Google tightens ad policies to align with Search spam rules - MarTech
item.description:
Google Tightens Ad Policies to Align with Search Spam Rules

Publication Date: March 2024 | Source: MarTech

Google has expanded its “Abusing the ad network” policy to disapprove ads linking to destinations penalized for violating its Search spam policies.

  • The policy automatically disapproves ads directing users to manually penalized websites.
  • This action links PPC performance to a site’s overall search health, affecting both organic and paid traffic.
  • It increases responsibilities for PPC and SEO managers to monitor Google Search Console closely.
  • Google aims to maintain a high-integrity digital ecosystem through these policy updates.
“This reinforces Google’s commitment to a high-integrity digital ecosystem.”

This policy update is essential for maintaining the quality of advertisements in relation to search engine integrity.

item.title: 6 trends to expect from flagship Android phones in 2025 - Android Authority
item.description:
6 Trends to Expect from Flagship Android Phones in 2025

Publication Date: N/A Source: Android Authority

The first wave of next-generation Android phones has launched, with expected advances in battery life, performance, and innovative features.

  • Much better battery life anticipated due to silicon batteries and more efficient processors.
  • Large performance boosts from Snapdragon 8 Elite and MediaTek Dimensity 9400 processors.
  • Thinner phones may return, with potential implications for battery capacity.
  • Price increases expected due to rising component costs.
  • Improved in-display fingerprint sensors gaining traction.
  • Increased availability of water-resistant phones with higher IP ratings.
“Between more efficient processors and much bigger batteries, we're expecting a major endurance boost in 2025.”

In conclusion, 2025 is set to bring numerous advancements to flagship Android phones, positioning them at the forefront of mobile technology.

item.title: WhatsApp to stop supporting THESE Android and iPhones from 2025: Check affected devices - ET Now
item.description:
WhatsApp to Stop Supporting Certain Android and iPhone Models from 2025

Updated Dec 26, 2024 20:37 IST

WhatsApp is set to discontinue support for older Android and iPhone devices beginning in 2025, affecting users with devices that cannot run the latest software.

  • Starting January 1, 2025, WhatsApp will not support Android devices running KitKat OS or older.
  • Affected Android devices include the Samsung Galaxy S3, Motorola Moto G (1st Gen), HTC One X, and several others.
  • iPhone users must upgrade by May 2025 to continue using WhatsApp, as support will end for devices operating on iOS 15.1 or lower.
  • This move aims to enhance security and app functionality as older devices cannot support new features effectively.
Meta explains, "without updates or security patches, these phones become more vulnerable to cyber threats."

Users with affected devices are encouraged to upgrade to newer models to continue using WhatsApp securely.

item.title: Best of 2024: Top smartphones launched in India this year - Deccan Herald
item.description:
Best of 2024: Top smartphones launched in India this year

Published: 26 December 2024, 15:05 IST

In 2024, we saw the launch of new exciting smartphones, more powerful and visually better designed than the ones launched the previous years.

  • Most versatile smartphone year of 2024: Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra

item.title: Apple Intelligence raises stakes in privacy and security - Security Intelligence
item.description:
Apple Intelligence Raises Stakes in Privacy and Security

Publication Date: October 2024 | Source: Apple Newsroom

Apple’s latest innovation, Apple Intelligence, is redefining consumer technology with advanced AI tools integrated into iOS, iPadOS, and macOS, offering vast economic opportunities alongside critical privacy and security questions.

Key Points

  • Advanced AI tools enhance personalization and productivity on Apple devices.
  • Real-time AI processing raises privacy and security risks, including potential social engineering exploits.
  • Apple emphasizes on-device processing to safeguard privacy along with its Economic Bounty Program for vulnerability identification.
  • AI technology presents both economic upside and security downsides, affecting users across sectors.

Notable Quotes or Statistics

“The real challenge lies in ensuring that this technology remains a force for good.”

Conclusion

The rollout of Apple Intelligence signifies a transformative era for consumer tech, balancing innovation with the necessity of protecting user trust and privacy.

item.title: The 5 best Apple Intelligence features to try right now on your new iPhone, iPad, or Mac - TechRadar
item.description:
The 5 best Apple Intelligence features to try right now on your new iPhone, iPad, or Mac

Publication Date: December 2023 Source: TechRadar

This article introduces five exciting Apple Intelligence features that new Apple device users can explore, highlighting the innovative AI capabilities available in the latest iPhones, iPads, and Macs.

  • 1. Genmoji: Create personalized emojis from your photos and more.
  • 2. Writing Tools: An advanced proofreading feature integrated throughout Apple’s platforms.
  • 3. Clean Up: Easily remove unwanted elements from your photos.
  • 4. ChatGPT in Siri: Siri now utilizes ChatGPT for complex inquiries.
  • 5. Notification Summaries: Summarized notifications for a cleaner experience.
“ChatGPT is now available inside Apple's voice assistant, meaning complex questions can be answered using OpenAI's AI model.”

With these features, Apple enhances user experience by integrating powerful AI tools across its product line, setting a foundation for more advanced functionalities to come.

item.title: Samsung Galaxy S23 Ultra price drops by 51 per cent: Here’s the new price - India TV News
item.description:
Samsung Galaxy S23 Ultra price drops by 51 per cent: Here’s the new price

Publication Date: December 2024 Source: India TV News

Samsung has dramatically reduced the price of its flagship Galaxy S23 Ultra 5G smartphone, making it more accessible for consumers. The device, which was originally priced at Rs 1,49,999, is now available for Rs 72,999, marking a significant 51% price cut.

New prices and offers

  • Latest Price: Rs 72,999 (from Rs 76,999)
  • Original Launch Price: Rs 1,49,999
  • Discount: 51 per cent price cut
  • EMI Option: Starting at Rs 3,539 per month
  • Additional benefits: Exchange offers and bank discounts

Key features of Samsung Galaxy S23 Ultra

Display:

  • 6.81-inch 2X Dynamic AMOLED screen
  • Resolution: 3088 x 1440 pixels
  • 120Hz refresh rate and in-display fingerprint sensor

Performance:

  • Powered by Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Gen 2 processor
  • 12GB RAM and up to 1TB internal storage
  • Runs on OneUI 5 based on Android 13

Camera setup:

Quad rear cameras:

  • 200MP primary with OIS
  • 10MP, 12MP and another 10MP lens
  • Front Camera: 12MP for selfies and video calls

Battery and charging:

  • 5000mAh battery capacity
  • Supports 45W wired and wireless charging

S-Pen support:

  • Enhanced productivity with the S-Pen integration

With its advanced AI features and a powerful 200MP camera, the Galaxy S23 Ultra presents exceptional value for tech enthusiasts at a more affordable price.

item.title: Here’s when most Galaxy S phones could get stable One UI 7 update - SamMobile - Samsung news
item.description:
When Galaxy S Phones Will Receive One UI 7 Update

Date: December 26, 2024 | Source: SamMobile

The Galaxy S24 has received beta updates, raising expectations for the One UI 7 update for older Galaxy S phones, but a recent report clarifies that older models like the Galaxy S23 will miss the beta.

Release Schedule for Stable One UI 7.0 Update

  • Samsung is expected to roll out stable One UI 7.0 for all Galaxy S series phones by February 2025.
  • No beta program for other Galaxy A or S series phones will be initiated.
  • The stable update is set to start in the first quarter of 2025, as promised by Samsung.
“Samsung has been quite late this year with the release of the new One UI update.”

One UI 7.0 will feature significant UI design changes, enhanced customization, and improved usability.

Editor's note: The article was updated to correct details about the update availability for Galaxy A series phones.

item.title: OpenAI’s GPT-5 Development Has Reportedly Suffered a Data Shortage Setback - Gadgets 360
item.description:
OpenAI’s GPT-5 Project Said to Be Delayed Due to Data Crunch

Date: Not specified Source: Gadgets360

OpenAI is reportedly facing delays in the development of its GPT-5 model, primarily due to training data shortages and high expenses related to the project. The AI model has been under development for over 18 months and is not yet ready for a profit.

  • OpenAI’s GPT-5 is codenamed Orion and is behind schedule.
  • The delays are attributed to insufficient training data and unexpected costs, with extensive training sessions costing around $500,000,000.
  • The model is currently only marginally better than existing OpenAI models.
  • Microsoft, OpenAI's major backer, is reportedly displeased with the delays, anticipating a mid-2024 release.
The expected cost of a six-month training session for GPT-5 is around $500 million.

In conclusion, the challenges faced by OpenAI in developing GPT-5 could significantly push back the timeline for its release, affecting its commercial viability and market expectations.

item.title: Bad Samsung news? One UI 7 rumor says beta is only coming to Galaxy S24 series - Tom's Guide
item.description:
Samsung's One UI 7 Beta Rumors Limited to Galaxy S24 Series

Publication Date: December 24, 2024

Source: Tom's Guide

The rumor mill suggests that Samsung may restrict the One UI 7 beta access exclusively to the Galaxy S24 series, which includes negative implications for users of previous models.

  • The One UI 7 beta is expected to roll out soon, initially for the Galaxy S24 in select markets like the US and UK.
  • Notable features include enhanced AI functionalities and a more personalized design.
  • Social media leaker claims no beta will come for Galaxy S23, S22, S21, or A series devices.
  • The stable rollout may be announced at a Samsung Galaxy Unpacked event scheduled for January 22, 2025.
“S24 series OneUI 7 beta 3 will release between 30th~6th (Can be +- 2 days). After beta 3 there'd be 2~3 more beta builds at max. S23/22/21/A series won't have any beta program.”

This rumor, if true, would mark a significant shift in Samsung's update policy and could affect user satisfaction.

item.title: Lenovo Said to Debut Self-Charging Bluetooth Keyboard and AI Travel Set at CES 2025 - Gadgets 360
item.description:
Lenovo to Unveil Self-Charging Keyboard and AI Travel Set at CES 2025

Publication Date: December 23, 2024 | Source: Gadgets 360

Lenovo is set to launch innovative products at CES 2025, including a self-charging Bluetooth keyboard and a new AI travel set.

  • The Bluetooth keyboard will feature self-charging technology using solar and ambient light.
  • It can connect to up to three devices and will be available in black and white.
  • The AI travel set includes a wristband, TWS earbuds, and a pendant with a camera, all designed to enhance AI performance on the go.
  • The launch will also feature other devices like the world's first laptop with a rollable screen.
“All the devices in the AI travel kit will connect with the smartphone to deliver maximum AI performance on the go.”

This showcase at CES 2025 highlights Lenovo's commitment to integrating AI and innovative design in their products.

item.title: AI told me to work out less and the results were a disaster - TechRadar
item.description:
AI told me to work out less and the results were a disaster

Publication Date: N/A Source: TechRadar

The article explores a personal experience with the Push app, which uses AI to generate workout plans. After following the app's suggestion to reduce workout days from six to four, the author faced unexpected challenges and frustration.

  • The Push app was initially praised for its ability to track fitness goals and generate effective workout plans.
  • The author's experiment to reduce workout frequency aimed to enhance recovery but led to frustration and unmet expectations.
  • Transitioning to fewer workouts resulted in longer gym sessions that disrupted the established routine.
  • The author reflects on the importance of maintaining enjoyment and structure in fitness routines.
“I realized that I actually love having a reason to go to the gym every day.”

In conclusion, the experience highlights the significance of personal preferences in workout routines and the necessity for adaptability in fitness plans.

item.title: Samsung still working hard on the ‘zero-bezel’ iPhone display - SamMobile - Samsung news
item.description:
Samsung still working hard on the 'zero-bezel' iPhone display

Publication Date: December 26, 2024

Source: SamMobile

Samsung Display continues to develop a 'zero-bezel' OLED panel for Apple’s iPhone, originally requested by Apple for a potential 2025 release; however, current projections suggest the technology may not be ready even by 2026.

  • Apple sources its OLED panels from Samsung and is exploring new designs for iPhones.
  • Samsung's proposed OLED displays would wrap around the device, eliminating bezels.
  • Technological advancements in adhesive and encapsulation are required to overcome challenges.
  • Korean media reports that Samsung's zero-bezel displays may debut on Galaxy phones before iPhones.
"With the current rate of progress, it's unlikely we'll see a zero-bezel iPhone even in 2026."

The development of the zero-bezel display is crucial for both Samsung and Apple, but delays may push the innovation further into the future.

item.title: Creating Holiday Greetings Or Hosting New Year’s Party? Here Are 5 Google Tools You Can Use - NDTV Profit
item.description:
Creating Holiday Greetings Or Hosting New Year’s Party? Here Are 5 Google Tools You Can Use

Date: 26 Dec 2024

Source: NDTV Profit Tech

Google's innovative tools can assist you in planning festive events and creating unique greetings for the New Year.

  • Get ideas for themed parties with Gemini Live.
  • Create festive greetings and invites using Google Photos.
  • Organize your plans and ideas with Google Keep.
  • Cook easily with the assistance of Google Lens.
  • Check food temperatures with the Pixel Thermometer app.
"Whether it’s creative themed ideas for new year’s celebration, creating fun and unique greetings and invites, or prepping and cooking for the party, Google’s smart tools can help take care of the nitty-gritty."

Google offers a variety of apps that can simplify holiday planning and enhance the festive spirit, making it easier to celebrate with family and friends.

item.title: WhatsApp for iOS introduces AR Effects, Backgrounds and Document Scanning - India TV News
item.description:
WhatsApp for iOS introduces AR Effects, Backgrounds and Document Scanning

Publication Date: December 2024 Source: India TV News

WhatsApp’s latest update for iOS introduces augmented reality (AR) effects to its camera feature, providing users with new creative options for capturing media.

  • Introduction of AR effects like confetti, underwater, and sparkles in the camera.
  • Customizable backgrounds to obscure surroundings in photos and videos.
  • Video color tone adjustment for a polished output.
  • New document scanning feature allows users to scan and share documents within WhatsApp.
  • Supports filters such as color, grayscale, and black-and-white.
  • Automatic cropping and border resizing for easier document processing.
  • New festive-themed features enhance messaging experiences.
  • Available in WhatsApp for iOS version 24.25.93.
“Users can enjoy a more versatile and engaging experience with the app.”

In conclusion, these updates significantly enhance the user experience on WhatsApp, especially with the integration of AR and document scanning features that cater to various user needs.
